abstract: Attorney General Andrew M. Cuomo’s office said Wednesday that it would begin investigating the office of William C. Thompson Jr., the New York City comptroller, as the fallout from a pension corruption inquiry continued to widen, The New York Times’s Danny Hakim reported.
lead_paragraph: Attorney General Andrew M. Cuomo’s office said Wednesday that it would begin investigating the office of William C. Thompson Jr., the New York City comptroller, as the fallout from a pension corruption inquiry continued to widen, The New York Times’s Danny Hakim reported.

headline.main: Pension Funds Inquiry Turns to New York City
